eventName: Such is the Joy of Our Reunion
storyInfo: Xingzhu takes Blaze all over Baizao in search of the tangerine cakes she remembers, but they do not find them. Eventually, the Young Chef suggests that Mo Bufu, head chef of Ding Feng Lou, might know how to make them.

attributes.content: Blaze, what do you think of this one?
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Mm... not bad!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: What I mean is, do these tangerine cakes taste like the ones you remember?
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Umm... well... not exactly.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: They're still not as sweet as the ones I had before. They also don't have quite the same mouth feel.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: That's strange. This place uses traditional cooking methods. Their snacks are definitely authentic. They haven't changed their recipes in one hundred years.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: One hundred years? Have tangerine cakes even been around that long?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: No, tangerine cakes are not quite that old, but many famous Baizao snacks do have quite a long history.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: The tangerine cake you are looking for were actually invented by a scholar who came to Baizao to study in its early years.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: The scholar's hometown was famous for its tangerines. After he moved to Baizao, he missed those tangerines. It was too far to go home and get them, so he improvised.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: He smashed up some old, dried tangerine peels and made them into dough, added some sugar, shortening, and spices, and baked them. It was a cheap, easy way to get his tangerine fix.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: He gave the recipe to his landlord in lieu of paying rent. He even wrote a small poem about them, 'These tangerine cakes are bright and fresh, just like the orange groves back home.'
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: After the scholar passed the imperial examination and assumed office, the tangerine cakes became very famous. People began to view them as a symbol of homesickness.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Interesting...
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Symbolic food. First time I've ever heard something like that.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Yan is a vast land, with many different climate zones, each with their own cash crops and produce. That's why there are many different types of Yanese cuisine. You can trace all of Yan's history through its food.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: For example, Yan's Four Major Cuisines match up with its Four Great Restaurants, which predate Baizao's transformation into a nomadic city.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Cities develop, but flavors remain. It would be odd to find any snack without its own bit of history behind it.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: One of my colleagues told me that there are many different kinds of Tianshis in Yan. You know so much about food, you must be some kind of Tasty Food Tianshi, right?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: If there really was such an individual, someone who could use Arts to transform stones into vegetables, that might be worth studying, eh?
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Alas, I am just an amateur foodie. I like to take notes on the food I eat, and its history. Over the years, I've compiled several notebooks full of such information.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: To put it another way, Blaze, if there really were a better recipe for tangerine cakes out there, surely someone here would know about it.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: But I'm telling you! The ones I had when I was younger, they were sweeter, and just better!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: That really is rather odd...
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Traditional tangerine cakes emphasize the fresh essence of the tangerines, not the taste of their pulp. Very little sugar is used, because tangerine cakes are supposed to be a light snack.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: You're telling me you've eaten much sweeter tangerine cakes, and I'm telling you that I've never heard of such a thing.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Maybe we can ask one of the chefs around here to try cooking up a batch with extra sugar, so you can compare?
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: But even if we do that, it doesn't prove that the sweeter variety of tangerine cakes ever actually existed before.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: What I want to know is, how did the taste of these tangerine cakes change during their journey from Baizao to Victoria. I'm sure there's a story there somewhere.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: It seems you're just as much of a foodie as I am.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: I was afraid you'd get tired of traipsing off to all these restaurants.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: You're the guide. You lead, I follow.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Alright then. Let's keep looking!
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: My word, look at the time! We should have lunch first.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Hmm? Lunch?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Yes. It's lunchtime. Shouldn't we have some lunch?
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: But I just finished eating snacks from five different restaurants!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Snacks are snacks, but lunch is lunch. You must have a proper lunch, you know!
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: I don't think my tummy has any more room for lunch...
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Haha. I know one restaurant that I can guarantee won't make your tummy ache.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Will you give it a try?
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: You're the foodie here, so I, and my stomach, trust you!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Hmm?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: What's wrong?
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: I feel like... we're being followed.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: You... you're... an Imperial Guard?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: No, no, no. Without darksteel armor, I'm not a proper member of the Imperial Guards. Officially, I'm a captain serving with the Yulin Guards.
attributes.name: Imposing Woman

attributes.content: Deputy Minister Lin, I doubt you'd want to encounter anyone wearing darksteel armor anyway, certainly not in broad daylight.
attributes.name: Imposing Woman

attributes.content: I once heard Taihe mention that there is a 'junior drillmaster' serving in the ranks the Imperial Guard apprentices. She's very young, but skilled beyond her years.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: That must be you. You're the junior drillmaster.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Hmph. I guess Taihe's still sore that I beat him in a couple matches last month. There's no need for name calling, though.
attributes.name: Junior Drillmaster

attributes.content: No matter. I'd like to ask you, what are you doing here?
attributes.name: Junior Drillmaster

attributes.content: I'm investigating a case.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Does that case have anything to do with the former Minister of Rites? Has the Judicial Review Office issued you a search warrant?
attributes.name: Junior Drillmaster

attributes.content: You're just a drillmaster. You have no authority to question whatever warrants I may or may not have, do you?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: You have no authority to question my authority. Just answer my questions, please.
attributes.name: Junior Drillmaster

attributes.content: ...Very well.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: I heard you were on a long business trip just recently. You left Baizao for a while, did you not?
attributes.name: Junior Drillmaster

attributes.content: That's right. I went to go question a witness in an old case and update the case files.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: What old case? From when? What witness? Why are you just investigating it now?
attributes.name: Junior Drillmaster

attributes.content: I don't understand your line of questioning.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: If the Yulin Guards want to investigate the Judicial Review Office, I'll go submit the necessary documentation immediately.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: If that still isn't enough for you, I can have the Minister of the Judicial Review Office report to the Yulin Guards for questioning.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: My questions have nothing to do with the Judicial Review Office. They only concern you, Deputy Minister Lin.
attributes.name: Junior Drillmaster

attributes.content: So you went to investigate an old case. What did you learn?
attributes.name: Junior Drillmaster

attributes.content: ...Too much time has passed, so the trail has gone cold. I didn't learn anything.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Nothing? Really? Are you sure?
attributes.name: Junior Drillmaster

attributes.content: Nothing.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Alright. I believe you. However, remember that you are speaking to the Yulin Guards here. Your answers carry great weight.
attributes.name: Junior Drillmaster

attributes.content: Very good. I'm done discussing official business for now.
attributes.name: Junior Drillmaster

attributes.content: So you still have some personal business you wish to discuss?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Taihe, that dumb Forte, told me he doesn't have many friends in government. Well, you now count as one.
attributes.name: Junior Drillmaster

attributes.content: Well, I must warn you, don't stick your neck out too far.
attributes.name: Junior Drillmaster

attributes.content: Your worries are unfounded. I'm just pursuing the truth here, as it is my job to do. I'm not putting myself at any additional risk.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: ...Very good.
attributes.name: Junior Drillmaster

attributes.content: Give Taihe my regards.
attributes.name: Junior Drillmaster

attributes.content: They are questioning why I'm here. Well, why are the Yulin Guards here?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Their presence here, I think, is proof that I'm on the right track.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Phew—
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Boy, am I stuffed. I never would have guessed that a roadside stand could make such amazing wontons. They're certainly better than the ones in the Rhodes Island cafeteria freezer!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I'm so stuffed that I want to just take a nap right here. Ah... nng...
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: After eating all that greasy street food, a nice, hearty bowl of wontons is the perfect thing to settle your stomach.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: The famous restaurants need no introduction. As your guide in Baizao, I figured I'd share some of my favorite lesser-known food spots.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Well I'm lucky to have found such a good tour guide. Thank you!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Well, I'm also glad to have found a culinary companion. I tend to eat alone, which means I can only order one or two entrees for myself.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: You know what they say, 'the more the merrier.' Now that I'm here, you can order as much food as you want.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Speaking of food, what is in these wontons, anyway? They're fantastic!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Just meat and celery. The key ingredient is the soup!
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Most places use shellbeast caviar in wonton soup to enhance the flavor. Unfortunately, the finniness of the caviar crowds out the other flavors.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: This place uses soybean sprouts instead. This makes for a milder soup, which allows the flavor of the wontons to shine!
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: The meat filling for the wontons is fresh beast belly. After the wontons are cooked, the bits of fat will naturally seep into the soup.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: These wontons are light, yet delicious. They are made of high-quality ingredients which are hard to find elsewhere.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Well, do these wontons have a history? Do tell.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Not really. I just really like this particular wonton shop, I guess.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: When I get writer's block, or need a little pick-me-up, I come here and eat a bowl of wontons.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: The shopkeeper has been making wontons her whole life. She used to own this shop together with her husband.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Her husband fell ill and passed away, leaving her to raise her child alone. Later, her son joined the army, but he died in a Catastrophe up north several years ago.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: She's still running the place all by herself. She says she wants to continue the family legacy and preserve their authentic taste.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: What a sad story.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: There are many such sad stories. There is no joy without pain.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Over the years, as I've been coming to this shop, I've helped the lady with an errand or two. In return, she told me her family's secret recipe. She hopes that one day, after she's gone, I can pass on her craft to the next generation.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: I have something I want to ask you.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Are you really going through all this trouble with the tangerine cakes just because you made a bet with the Young Chef?
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Why do you ask?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I simply noticed that you weren't terribly focused on the taste of the delicacies at all. It seemed like you had some other purpose in mind.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Was it that obvious? Wow...
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: When you watch people eat, you see into their souls.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Sorry, I was just curious. If I've intruded on your privacy, I sincerely apologize.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Hey now! We're friends! I'm not keeping secrets from you.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: You're right. I'm not really that concerned about the bet.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Those tangerine cakes, well, my father used to send them to me when he was living in Baizao.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Your father, was he Yanese?
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Err... meh, whatever. I don't have anything to hide from you.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I grew up in Victoria, and my father is Yanese. One year, he suddenly returned to Yan for some reason.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I never saw him again, and he died over a decade later in a land foreign to me.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I'm sorry, Blaze...
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: It's not your fault. Why do you keep apologizing?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I didn't think much about it at first, but yesterday when you mentioned that sweet tangerine cakes are unusual, I thought, 'someone who knows how to make those cakes might have also known my dad.'
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Your dad… was also…
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: He was also what?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Oh... nothing...
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Well, I promise you that I will do everything in my power to help you find out the truth about your father—
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: You're such a contradiction—so bold when you eat, yet so refined when you speak.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: When we're eating together, it's all good fun; we're good friends. Why do you turn into a different person as soon as you put down your chopsticks?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Friends?
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: And another thing, why are you helping me look for these tangerine cakes in the first place?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Well, I'm writing a book.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Most cookbooks today only contain recipes from renowned chefs, yet the streets and the countryside are full of unique delicacies that few people ever pay heed.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: I hope to collect all these recipes into a book. Perhaps, years later, people will read this book and learn of Baizao's unique cuisine. Hm... it's just a silly dream of mine, is all.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: And also...
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I think I'll keep that a secret for now.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Well, as long as we're out here, you might as well take me to a few more places, yeah?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Sure! Where do you want to go?
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Let me see... this letter mentions the Virtue Bookstore, the Humble Garden, and the Baizao Academy.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Hey... what does this word mean?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Can you let me have a look?
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: This is a letter? Why is it so greasy?
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: I didn't do that! It was like that when I opened it! I don't know what my dad was doing when he wrote it.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: So these are all letters that your father wrote to you?
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Yes. The few that I managed to save.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: (Strange, this stationery... it's...)
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Hmm? What is it?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: N-Nothing. It's just that most of the places mentioned in this letter no longer exist.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Huh? But it was only written a decade ago.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: For Baizao, a decade is enough for the whole city to change.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Have you noticed that anything has changed since arriving in Baizao?
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Well, aside from the food, there are all these energy poles all over the place. It seems like kind of a waste.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: It may seem wasteful, but in fact, we have no other choice.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: The city of Baizao was founded a long, long time ago.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: At that time, Yan had just experienced a great war, and the country was in dire straits. However, suddenly, an extremely rich Originium vein was discovered right next to the ruins of a battlefield.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Wow. What impeccable timing! You Yanese sure are lucky!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: No. It wasn't lucky at all. The Originium vein was rich... too rich. It attracted too many Originium particles in one place, which eventually led to Catastrophe.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Basically, not only was it difficult to mine, but it also created a vast stretch of land that was prone to Catastrophes, and there was nothing the Yanese could do about it.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: That is, until one of the Tianshis had an idea—they could build a city right on top of the Originium vein. The city infrastructure would deplete the excess Originium energy, preventing further Catastrophes.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Building a city on top of an Originium mine? That sounds like a recipe for disaster!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: It was indeed an extremely dangerous undertaking. However, the True Lung decided to go ahead with it... and that's how Baizao was founded.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: How did they do it? I can't even imagine...
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Honestly, I'm not totally sure either. In all the Yanese history books, there is only a single passage that talks about that period—
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: 'Skilled individuals were sent to the disaster zone, and after fifty-three years of effort, a city was built and established as the capital. The city was named Baizao, with the hope of tending all cooking stoves under heaven.'
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: As for the more advanced technical details, you'd probably have to look at some of the materials from the Tianshi Bureaus. That's beyond my area of expertise.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: So to this day, the Baizao government still encourages us to use this energy.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Baizao is constantly changing. That's how these skyscrapers appeared, as well as the numerous nomadic city plates.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: And what happened to the people who built the city?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: *sigh*...
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I'm completely stuffed, but I still haven't found the taste I'm looking for.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I've taken you to every restaurant I know that sells such cakes.
attributes.name: Xingzhu
Xingzhu
attributes.content: Maybe tomorrow we can go look in some of the larger restaurants.

attributes.name: Xingzhu
attributes.content: *burp*
What did I tell you? What did I tell you?
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: You looked the whole day, yet you couldn't find your so-called, 'authentic tangerine cakes', could you?
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: You were following us all day?
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: You were afraid we would find better food, weren't you?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Me? Afraid? Pah!
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: I already told you before, if you're looking for the best chef in Baizao, you've already found him. If I can't cook it, no one else can.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Blaze, I've tasted his food. It really is quite excellent. A rare treat.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: You really know how to flatter!
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Besides, you're arguing over the details in how a single pastry is made—how could that possibly be the standard for judging a chef's skill?
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Still, I can see that you, chef, are still curious about these sweet tangerine cakes that Blaze is talking about, are you not?
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: ....Not really.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: How about this? You two set aside your bet, and we'll see where we can find these sweet tangerine cakes.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: That way, Blaze will find the tangerine cakes she's looking for, and you, chef, will learn a new recipe. Sounds like a delightful arrangement, no?
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Huh? What?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: What about my one month of free meals?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Hmph, my cooking skills are so superb that no one can match them, but there are other chefs that I respect. If I had to name one in particular, it would be...
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Well... it would be...
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Who?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: The head chef of Ding Feng Lou, the highest rated of the Four Great Restaurants.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: You mean, Mr. Mo Bufu?
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Everyone at Ding Feng Lou is busy preparing for the Feast of a Hundred Delicacies. That means the old man is prepping for his last feast.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: His last feast? You mean, he's retiring?
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Who knows! That old man's been challenging people left and right lately—really showing off...
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: What are you waiting for? Let's go!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: It's not so simple...
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Chef Mo is quite an important man. He is responsible for the entire feast. We can't bother him with trifling matters such as some tangerine cakes.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: The girl is clever, but she's only half right. If you really do want to go meet him, I have a way.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Last month's receipts?
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: No. Not in this pocket...
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Ah. Here it is.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: An invitation to the Ding Feng Lou Chef Selection...
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Blaze, we won't get many opportunities to meet Chef Mo.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Then what are we waiting for? Whoever is going to the competition, take me with you!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: As to who will participate in the competition...
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Huh? What are you looking at me for?
attributes.name: Blaze
